attributes.name: data
attributes.desc: table data

attributes.name: height
attributes.desc: table's height. By default it has an auto height. If its value is a number, the height is measured in pixels; if its value is a string, the value will be assigned to element's style.height, the height is affected by external styles

attributes.name: max-height
attributes.desc: table's max-height. The legal value is a number or the height in px

attributes.name: stripe
attributes.desc: whether Table is striped

attributes.name: border
attributes.desc: whether Table has vertical border

attributes.name: size
attributes.desc: size of Table

attributes.name: fit
attributes.desc: whether width of column automatically fits its container

attributes.name: show-header
attributes.desc: whether Table header is visible

attributes.name: highlight-current-row
attributes.desc: whether current row is highlighted

attributes.name: current-row-key
attributes.desc: key of current row, a set only prop

attributes.name: row-class-name
attributes.desc: function that returns custom class names for a row, or a string assigning class names for every row

attributes.name: row-style
attributes.desc: function that returns custom style for a row, or an object assigning custom style for every row

attributes.name: cell-class-name
attributes.desc: function that returns custom class names for a cell, or a string assigning class names for every cell
attributes.optionValue: (data: { row: any, column: any, rowIndex: number, columnIndex: number }) => string

attributes.name: cell-style
attributes.desc: function that returns custom style for a cell, or an object assigning custom style for every cell
attributes.optionValue: (data: { row: any, column: any, rowIndex: number, columnIndex: number }) => CSSProperties

attributes.name: header-row-class-name
attributes.desc: function that returns custom class names for a row in table header, or a string assigning class names for every row in table header

attributes.name: header-row-style
attributes.desc: function that returns custom style for a row in table header, or an object assigning custom style for every row in table header

attributes.name: header-cell-class-name
attributes.desc: function that returns custom class names for a cell in table header, or a string assigning class names for every cell in table header
attributes.optionValue: (data: { row: any, column: any, rowIndex: number, columnIndex: number }) => string

attributes.name: header-cell-style
attributes.desc: function that returns custom style for a cell in table header, or an object assigning custom style for every cell in table header
attributes.optionValue: (data: { row: any, column: any, rowIndex: number, columnIndex: number }) => CSSProperties

attributes.name: row-key
attributes.desc: key of row data, used for optimizing rendering. Required if reserve-selection is on or display tree data. When its type is String, multi-level access is supported, e.g. user.info.id, but user.info[0].id is not supported, in which case Function should be used

attributes.name: empty-text
attributes.desc: displayed text when data is empty. You can customize this area with #empty

attributes.name: default-expand-all
attributes.desc: whether expand all rows by default, works when the table has a column type="expand" or contains tree structure data

attributes.name: expand-row-keys
attributes.desc: set expanded rows by this prop, prop's value is the keys of expand rows, you should set row-key before using this prop

attributes.name: default-sort
attributes.desc: set the default sort column and order. property prop is used to set default sort column, property order is used to set default sort order
attributes.defaultValue: if prop is set, and order is not set, then order is default to ascending

attributes.name: tooltip-effect
attributes.desc: the effect of the overflow tooltip

attributes.name: tooltip-options
attributes.desc: the options for the overflow tooltip, [see the following tooltip component](tooltip.html#attributes)(2.2.28)
attributes.optionValue: Pick<ElTooltipProps, effect | enterable | hideAfter | offset | placement | popperClass | popperOptions | showAfter | showArrow>
attributes.defaultValue: object`{ enterable: true, placement: 'top', showArrow: true, hideAfter: 200, popperOptions: { strategy: 'fixed' } }`

attributes.name: append-filter-panel-to
attributes.desc: which element the filter panels appends to(2.8.4)

attributes.name: show-summary
attributes.desc: whether to display a summary row

attributes.name: sum-text
attributes.desc: displayed text for the first column of summary row

attributes.name: summary-method
attributes.desc: custom summary method

attributes.name: span-method
attributes.desc: method that returns rowspan and colspan
attributes.optionValue: (data: { row: any, column: any, rowIndex: number, columnIndex: number }) => number[] | { rowspan: number, colspan: number } | void

attributes.name: select-on-indeterminate
attributes.desc: controls the behavior of master checkbox in multi-select tables when only some rows are selected (but not all). If true, all rows will be selected, else deselected

attributes.name: indent
attributes.desc: horizontal indentation of tree data

attributes.name: lazy
attributes.desc: whether to lazy loading data

attributes.name: load
attributes.desc: method for loading child row data, only works when lazy is true
attributes.optionValue: (row: any, treeNode: TreeNode, resolve: (data: any[]) => void) => void

attributes.name: tree-props
attributes.desc: configuration for rendering nested data
attributes.optionValue: { hasChildren?: string, children?: string, checkStrictly?: boolean }

attributes.name: table-layout
attributes.desc: sets the algorithm used to lay out table cells, rows, and columns

attributes.name: scrollbar-always-on
attributes.desc: always show scrollbar

attributes.name: show-overflow-tooltip
attributes.desc: whether to hide extra content and show them in a tooltip when hovering on the cell.It will affect all the table columns, refer to table [tooltip-options](#table-attributes)

attributes.name: flexible
attributes.desc: ensure main axis minimum-size doesn't follow the content(2.2.1)

attributes.name: scrollbar-tabindex
attributes.desc: body scrollbar's wrap container tabindex(2.8.3)

attributes.name: allow-drag-last-column
attributes.desc: whether to allow drag the last column(2.9.2)

attributes.name: tooltip-formatter
attributes.desc: customize tooltip content when using show-overflow-tooltip(2.9.4)
attributes.optionValue: (data: { row: any, column: any, cellValue: any }) => VNode | string

attributes.name: preserve-expanded-content
attributes.desc: whether to preserve expanded row content in DOM when collapsed(2.9.7)

slots.name: append
slots.desc: Contents to be inserted after the last row. You may need this slot if you want to implement infinite scroll for the table. This slot will be displayed above the summary row if there is one.

slots.name: empty
slots.desc: you can customize content when data is empty.

events.name: @select
events.desc: triggers when user clicks the checkbox in a row
events.param: Function<T = any>(selection: T[, row: T) => void

events.name: @select-all
events.desc: triggers when user clicks the checkbox in table header

events.name: @cell-mouse-enter
events.desc: triggers when hovering into a cell
events.param: Function(row: any, column: any, cell: HTMLTableCellElement, event: Event) => void

events.name: @cell-mouse-leave
events.desc: triggers when hovering out of a cell
events.param: Function(row: any, column: any, cell: HTMLTableCellElement, event: Event) => void

events.name: @cell-click
events.param: Function(row: any, column: any, cell: HTMLTableCellElement, event: Event) => void

events.name: @cell-dblclick
events.desc: triggers when double clicking a cell
events.param: Function(row: any, column: any, cell: HTMLTableCellElement, event: Event) => void

events.name: @cell-contextmenu
events.desc: triggers when user right clicks on a cell
events.param: Function(row: any, column: any, cell: HTMLTableCellElement, event: Event) => void

events.name: @row-click
events.param: Function(row: any, column: any, event: Event) => void

events.name: @row-contextmenu
events.desc: triggers when user right clicks on a row
events.param: Function(row: any, column: any, event: Event) => void

events.name: @row-dblclick
events.desc: triggers when double clicking a row
events.param: Function(row: any, column: any, event: Event) => void

events.name: @header-click
events.desc: triggers when clicking a column header

events.name: @header-contextmenu
events.desc: triggers when user right clicks on a column header

events.name: @sort-change
events.param: Function(data: {column: any, prop: string, order: any }) => void

events.name: @filter-change
events.desc: column's key. If you need to use the filter-change event, this attribute is mandatory to identify which column is being filtered

events.name: @header-dragend
events.desc: triggers after changing a column's width by dragging the column header's border
events.param: Function(newWidth: number, oldWidth: number, column: any, event: MouseEvent) => void

events.name: @expand-change
events.desc: triggers when user expands or collapses a row (for expandable table, second param is expandedRows; for tree Table, second param is expanded)
events.param: Function(row: any, expandedRows: any[) => void & (row: any, expanded: boolean) => void

events.name: @scroll
events.param: Function({ scrollLeft: number, scrollTop: number }) => void

methods.name: clearSelection
methods.desc: used in multiple selection Table, clear user selection

methods.name: toggleRowSelection
methods.desc: used in multiple selection Table, toggle if a certain row is selected. With the second parameter, you can directly set if this row is selected
methods.param: Function(row: any, selected?: boolean, ignoreSelectable = true) => void

methods.name: toggleAllSelection
methods.desc: used in multiple selection Table, toggle select all and deselect all

methods.name: toggleRowExpansion
methods.desc: used in expandable Table or tree Table, toggle if a certain row is expanded. With the second parameter, you can directly set if this row is expanded or collapsed

methods.name: setCurrentRow
methods.desc: used in single selection Table, set a certain row selected. If called without any parameter, it will clear selection

methods.name: clearSort
methods.desc: clear sorting, restore data to the original order

methods.name: clearFilter
methods.desc: clear filters of the columns whose `columnKey` are passed in. If no params, clear all filters

methods.name: doLayout
methods.desc: refresh the layout of Table. When the visibility of Table changes, you may need to call this method to get a correct layout

methods.name: sort
methods.desc: sort Table manually. Property `prop` is used to set sort column, property `order` is used to set sort order

methods.name: scrollTo
methods.desc: scrolls to a particular set of coordinates
methods.param: Function(options: number | ScrollToOptions, yCoord?: number) => void

methods.name: updateKeyChildren
methods.desc: used in lazy Table, must set `rowKey`, update key children(2.8.4)
